H0.text: Solvation is the process by which individual ions, after separating from the crystal, become surrounded by solvent particles.

H1.text: Osmosis is the process that occurs after a crystal dissociates, in which individual ions are surrounded by solvent particles.

H2.text: Ionization is the process in which, after coming apart from the crystal, the individual ions are then surrounded by solvent particles.

H3.text: Hydrolysis is the process in which individual ions, after dissociating from a crystal, are surrounded by solvent particles.

A4.text: If the attractive forces between the solvent and solute particles are greater than the attractive forces holding the solute particles together, the solvent particles pull the solute particles apart and surround them.

A5.text: Ions are surrounded by a concentric shell of solvent.
